myself you may make and construct this pattern and sell what you make from this pattern but you may not sell or give away the pattern itself page 1 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com here he comes to save the day … pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together for the small animal picture above size g hook worsted weight yarn red heart works nicely  white main body color  red for cape  blue for boots and gloves  red white and blue variegated main body color gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = single_crochet two stitches together chain 1 t = chain 1 turn note buster is worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic magic_ring have fun and be creative page 2 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com head row instruction stitches 1 using white 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 *single_crochet in decrease* around 24 14 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet decrease* around slip_stitch join and bind off leave a 18 tail about 8 long so you can sew the head to the body later on stuff head
